flaggedItem.plan:
Show the first version, get them everyone on the platform and enable them to start using the first version of Propel

  • Show and tell: show and explain how everything works in Propel

  • Big turnout with all teams joining - all team members of the piloting partners joining

  • Engagement from (senior) management / person in the lead

  • Amount of questions and level of questions asked

  • Interaction with the teams during the sessions

  • Provide them with goal/homework of what to work on in the first week as kickstarter to start using the platform

  • Guidelines were shared for people to use as a reference
flaggedItem.reality:
• Overall successful turnout - mix of only leads and full teams (beyond people invited even)

  • For some of them, the senior managers and regional managers were not present

  • They understand how they want to use Propel (indicated by the questions they asked) - already thinging about how Propel can be applied

  • Scheduling was difficult to reach everyone and for them to make it a priority

  • Reaching everyone and scheduling sessions takes more time than expected (total of 3 weeks for onboarding of 6 partners)

  • One partner - SUDIA - could not be onboarded and piloting is on hold because of the conflict in Sudan

  • Had clear tasks and clear follow-up emails to all the piloting partners to make sure they know what to do

  • We don't know if and how people are using the guidelines

  • From some of the partners we know they started immediately using and exploring Propel, also asking questions and giving feedback. From others, we don't exactly know if and how they went on the platform

learningQuestion.title: How can we increase the representation of women in community peacebuilding and livelihood activities?

flaggedItem.description:
Our assessments reveal that while many local facilities have been established, there are gaps in their functionality, accessibility, and sustainability. Addressing these will directly contribute to improving the quality of life and overall community well-being.


Improved local facilities not only serve the immediate needs of the community but also act as a foundation for long-term socio-economic development, attracting businesses, and fostering community pride and unity.

learningQuestion.title: What we can do to improve local facilities?

flaggedItem.plan:
Nous avons prévu de mettre en œuvre 17 nouveaux projets dans la région du Darfour, afin de renforcer la consolidation de la paix au niveau communautaire, l'intégration de la dimension de genre et la résolution des conflits au niveau local.

Nos principaux objectifs étaient de renforcer les mécanismes communautaires de résolution des conflits et de réconciliation, de garantir les dividendes de la paix pour l'interdépendance des communautés, de promouvoir les organisations de femmes dans la consolidation de la paix et de soutenir les réseaux de consolidation de la paix.
flaggedItem.reality: Nous avons réussi à intégrer 17 organisations pour mettre en œuvre les projets, touchant ainsi plus de 1,5 million de personnes dans 26 localités.
flaggedItem.next: Pour la prochaine fois, nous reconsidérerons les critères de sélection des partenaires de mise en œuvre (PM) afin de garantir une plus grande portée et efficacité dans la mise en œuvre des projets.
flaggedItem.needs:
Nous avons besoin d'un plus grand nombre de sessions d'engagement communautaire pour mieux comprendre les défis qui se posent sur le terrain.

Un financement supplémentaire pourrait accélérer la mise en œuvre de projets spécifiques.

learningQuestion.title: Quels sont les mécanismes de gestion des conflits qui peuvent être appliqués ?

flaggedItem.description:
Nos recherches montrent que si les CBRM sont efficaces au niveau local, il existe une lacune notable dans leur intégration aux structures administratives de plus haut niveau. Pour maximiser l'impact des MRC, il est essentiel d'établir des liens avec les unités administratives, les localités, l'État et le niveau national.

En établissant ces liens, nous pouvons nous assurer que les résolutions prises au niveau communautaire sont reconnues et soutenues par les autorités supérieures. Cela permet non seulement d'accroître l'efficacité des MRC, mais aussi de renforcer leur légitimité, leur fiabilité et leur durabilité.

learningQuestion.title: Comment pouvons-nous établir des liens entre les MRCB et les espaces de développement communautaire de niveau supérieur, à la fois au niveau de l'unité administrative, de la localité, de l'État et du pays ?

flaggedItem.description:
Nos évaluations révèlent que si de nombreuses installations locales ont été mises en place, leur fonctionnalité, leur accessibilité et leur durabilité présentent des lacunes. Le fait de combler ces lacunes contribuera directement à l'amélioration de la qualité de vie et du bien-être général de la communauté.

L'amélioration des infrastructures locales ne répond pas seulement aux besoins immédiats de la communauté, mais sert également de base au développement socio-économique à long terme, en attirant des entreprises et en favorisant la fierté et l'unité de la communauté.

learningQuestion.title: Que pouvons-nous faire pour améliorer les infrastructures locales ?

flaggedItem.reality: Garantir les dividendes de la paix pour l'interdépendance et la coexistence des communautés grâce à des moyens de subsistance diversifiés et à une gestion efficace des ressources naturelles 41 000 animaux sont vaccinés, 8 pépinières communautaires sont créées. 319 kilomètres d'itinéraires de migration délimités

learningQuestion.title: Comment pouvons-nous améliorer la santé et la sécurité dans les zones locales ?

flaggedItem.reality: Pour renforcer l'interaction14, des événements sportifs et culturels sont organisés pour promouvoir la cohésion sociale.

learningQuestion.title: Comment soutenir l'interaction et le partage entre les membres locaux ?

flaggedItem.description:
Our research indicates that while many peacebuilding initiatives show initial promise, their long-term sustainability remains a challenge. It's imperative that solutions aren’t just effective in the short-term, but remain resilient and adaptable over time, ensuring lasting peace and development in Darfur.

"Sustainable peacebuilding not only prevents future conflicts but also lays the foundation for steady social, economic, and infrastructural development. Ensuring the durability of our solutions means a prolonged period of stability, allowing communities to grow and prosper without the looming threat of regression.

learningQuestion.title: How we can make sure that provided solutions are durable?
learningQuestion.summary: Our research highlights the importance of sustainable peacebuilding initiatives in Darfur, emphasizing the need for long-term resilience and adaptability to ensure lasting peace and development. Involving the community from the beginning increases the chances of success, while flexibility and addressing root causes like resource scarcity are crucial for durability. Challenges include maintaining functionality in the face of external pressures and the fragility of the peacebuilding process due to economic hardships. Key learnings include the significance of community involvement, adaptability, and addressing root causes for lasting impact. Opportunities lie in promoting social cohesion and economic resilience through income-generating activities. Challenges include external pressures and economic instability. Key actions include prioritizing community involvement, ensuring flexibility, and addressing root causes for sustainable peacebuilding in Darfur.

flaggedItem.plan:
• We planned to promote peacebuilding and social cohesion in Darfur using a community-led approach.

  • We aimed to support the establishment and training of Community Based Reconciliation Mechanisms (CBRMs) in the five states to handle and resolve disputes before thefive states to handle and resolve disputes before they escalate.
flaggedItem.reality:
• What happened is a total of 142 CBRMs were established, composed of 2044 members across the 26 project target locations in 2021.

  • These CBRMs were trained in various areas, and they reported a total of 1074 cases in 2021. Out of these, 893 were resolved, 148 remained unresolved, and 33 were forwarded to formal courts.

learningQuestion.title: How can we form and strengthen homegrown conflict resolution and peacebuilding mechanisms through which communities can resolve disputes before they escalate into conflict?

flaggedItem.description:
Nos recherches indiquent que si de nombreuses initiatives de consolidation de la paix sont prometteuses au départ, leur viabilité à long terme reste un défi. Il est impératif que les solutions ne soient pas seulement efficaces à court terme, mais qu'elles restent résilientes et adaptables au fil du temps, afin de garantir une paix et un développement durables au Darfour.

La consolidation durable de la paix permet non seulement de prévenir les conflits futurs, mais aussi de jeter les bases d'un développement social, économique et infrastructurel régulier. Garantir la durabilité de nos solutions signifie une période prolongée de stabilité, permettant aux communautés de croître et de prospérer sans la menace imminente d'une régression.

learningQuestion.title: Comment s'assurer que les solutions proposées sont durables ?

flaggedItem.plan:
We planned to implement 17 new projects across the Darfur region, enhancing community peacebuilding, gender mainstreaming, and local conflict resolution.

Our main objectives were to strengthen Community-Based Conflict Resolution/Reconciliation Mechanisms, ensure peace dividends for community interdependence, promote women's organizations in peacebuilding, and support peacebuilding networks.
flaggedItem.reality:
What happened is we successfully on-boarded 17 organizations to implement the projects, reaching over 1.5 million people across 26 localities.

We observed a deviation in the number of localities initially targeted and those we were able to operate in, potentially due to changing contexts in Darfur.
flaggedItem.next:
For next time, we would reconsider the selection criteria for Implementing Partners (IPs) to ensure a broader reach and efficiency in project implementation.

We might want to explore additional strategies for gender mainstreaming.
flaggedItem.needs:
We need more of community engagement sessions to understand ground-level challenges better.

Additional funding could accelerate the implementation of specific projects.

learningQuestion.title: What might be the conflict management mechanisms that can be applied?
learningQuestion.summary: We successfully implemented 17 new projects in the Darfur region, focusing on community peacebuilding, gender mainstreaming, and local conflict resolution, reaching over 1.5 million people across 26 localities. The projects aimed to strengthen conflict resolution mechanisms, promote women's organizations, and support peacebuilding networks. The research showed active use of Community-Based Resolution Mechanisms, contributing to community stabilization and improved security. Challenges included deviations in targeted localities and unresolved conflict cases. Key learnings include the importance of community engagement, gender mainstreaming, and efficient conflict resolution mechanisms. Opportunities identified are exploring additional gender mainstreaming strategies and increasing community engagement sessions. Challenges include timely resource allocation to implementing partners. Key actions include revising selection criteria for partners, exploring additional gender mainstreaming strategies, and ensuring efficient conflict resolution mechanisms.

flaggedItem.description:
Our research, in line with the UNDAF outcome for 2021, shows that community-based conflict resolution mechanisms have been actively employed, leading to the stabilization and improved security of communities affected by conflict. These efforts, particularly the functioning of 162 Community-Based Resolution Mechanisms (CBRMs) and the successful addressing of thousands of cases, demonstrate the strides made in ensuring peaceful coexistence and social cohesion in the region."

These conflict management mechanisms, combined with peace dividends and support for peace infrastructures, contribute substantially to the achievement of SDG 16. They lay the groundwork for a stable, prosperous, and resilient Darfur where intercommunal tensions are mitigated, and communities are empowered through livelihood activities

learningQuestion.title: What might be the conflict management mechanisms that can be applied?
learningQuestion.summary: We successfully implemented 17 new projects in the Darfur region, focusing on community peacebuilding, gender mainstreaming, and local conflict resolution, reaching over 1.5 million people across 26 localities. The projects aimed to strengthen conflict resolution mechanisms, promote women's organizations, and support peacebuilding networks. The research showed active use of Community-Based Resolution Mechanisms, contributing to community stabilization and improved security. Challenges included deviations in targeted localities and unresolved conflict cases. Key learnings include the importance of community engagement, gender mainstreaming, and efficient conflict resolution mechanisms. Opportunities identified are exploring additional gender mainstreaming strategies and increasing community engagement sessions. Challenges include timely resource allocation to implementing partners. Key actions include revising selection criteria for partners, exploring additional gender mainstreaming strategies, and ensuring efficient conflict resolution mechanisms.

flaggedItem.plan:
Nous avons prévu de promouvoir la consolidation de la paix et la cohésion sociale au Darfour en utilisant une approche communautaire.

Nous voulions soutenir la mise en place et la formation de mécanismes de réconciliation communautaires dans les cinq États pour traiter et résoudre les conflits avant qu'ils ne s'aggravent.
flaggedItem.reality:
Ce qui s'est passé, c'est qu'un total de 142 CBRM ont été créés, composés de 2044 membres dans les 26 localités ciblées par le projet en 2021.

Ces CBRM ont été formés dans différents domaines et ont signalé un total de 1074 cas en 2021. Parmi ceux-ci, 893 ont été résolus, 148 sont restés non résolus et 33 ont été transmis aux tribunaux officiels.

learningQuestion.title: Comment pouvons-nous créer et renforcer des mécanismes locaux de résolution des conflits et de consolidation de la paix permettant aux communautés de résoudre les différends avant qu'ils ne dégénèrent en conflit ?

flaggedItem.description:
Nos enquêtes soulignent la nécessité de trouver des solutions locales au Darfour. L'exploitation des connaissances indigènes et la compréhension des dynamiques communautaires peuvent être essentielles pour éviter que des différends mineurs ne dégénèrent en conflits majeurs. Le succès des mécanismes de résolution à base communautaire (MRCC), qui permettent de résoudre des affaires avant qu'elles ne soient portées devant les tribunaux officiels, montre qu'une approche localisée peut permettre de gérer et d'atténuer les tensions de manière efficace.

En confiant la résolution des conflits aux membres de la communauté, nous favorisons chez eux un sentiment d'appropriation, de responsabilité et d'autonomisation. Cette approche ascendante permet non seulement de s'attaquer aux causes profondes des conflits, mais aussi de promouvoir une culture de la paix, du dialogue et du respect mutuel, composantes essentielles d'un développement communautaire durable.

learningQuestion.title: Comment pouvons-nous créer et renforcer des mécanismes locaux de résolution des conflits et de consolidation de la paix permettant aux communautés de résoudre les différends avant qu'ils ne dégénèrent en conflit ?

learningQuestion.title: What might be the conflict management mechanisms that can be applied?
learningQuestion.summary: We successfully implemented 17 new projects in the Darfur region, focusing on community peacebuilding, gender mainstreaming, and local conflict resolution, reaching over 1.5 million people across 26 localities. The projects aimed to strengthen conflict resolution mechanisms, promote women's organizations, and support peacebuilding networks. The research showed active use of Community-Based Resolution Mechanisms, contributing to community stabilization and improved security. Challenges included deviations in targeted localities and unresolved conflict cases. Key learnings include the importance of community engagement, gender mainstreaming, and efficient conflict resolution mechanisms. Opportunities identified are exploring additional gender mainstreaming strategies and increasing community engagement sessions. Challenges include timely resource allocation to implementing partners. Key actions include revising selection criteria for partners, exploring additional gender mainstreaming strategies, and ensuring efficient conflict resolution mechanisms.

flaggedItem.description: The creation of 162 new CBRMs, of which 20 were revived, effectively addressed thousands of cases, showcasing the community's active participation in conflict resolution.
